title: IS THIS REALLY BETTER THAN A TILLER? A DISC THATS MADE IN THE USA!

tasks.task: Disc Harrowing with a Dirt Dog disc on a Kubota M4 Tractor
subtasks: Assembling the Dirt Dog disc attachment on the Kubota M4 three-point hitch
Adjusting the disc's offset for tilling depth and angle (two rows, offsettable)
Selecting the appropriate disc setting (four positions; most aggressive for initial passes)
Driving the Kubota M4 tractor with the disc attached over the field (two passes per area)
Manually adjusting hydraulic top link and disc angle for optimal soil penetration
Observing and analyzing disc harrow results on previously tilled vs. virgin soil
Recognizing limitations of a disc harrow compared to a rototiller for seedbed preparation
Considering cross tilling techniques for more uniform soil disruption on challenging terrain

tasks.task: Demonstrating the use of a scraper kit attachment for the disc
subtasks: Installing the optional scraper kit on the disc
Spotting and cleaning debris from the disc while operating
Evaluating the effectiveness of the scraper kit in reducing mud and residue cling

tasks.task: Preparing the farm ground for a screening cover using a combination of deep tillage and disc harrowing

Conducting multiple passes with varying disc angles to target heavy sod and debris
Compensating for younger equipment (four-foot disc on compact tractor) through technique and speed adjustments
Adjusting tractor speed (second to third gear in low range: 2.1-2.56 mph) for optimal performance
Evaluating the finished seedbed for suitability despite limited tillage due to time constraints
